name: Linux Executable File
summary: Learn about .X86 files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: To enable execution of the X86 file, right-click the file, select Properties, click the "Permissions" tab, and check the "Allow executing file as program" checkbox next to "Execute." If Linux still fails to run the X86 file, it's most likely dynamically linked to libraries, so you will need to install the missing libraries before the X86 file can be run.

description: Executable program file created for the Linux operating system; contains an application in binary format that is run as an executable; similar to the .EXE file in Microsoft Windows.
